general.allowedLanguagesDesc: Select which languages should be available in TTS and segmentation dropdowns

xtts.temperatureDesc: The softmax temperature of the autoregressive model (0.65 default)
xtts.lengthPenaltyDesc: A length penalty applied to the autoregressive decoder. Higher settings cause the model to produce more terse outputs (1.0 default)
xtts.repetitionPenaltyDesc: A penalty that prevents the autoregressive decoder from repeating itself. Can be used to reduce long silences or uhhs (2.0 default)
xtts.topKDesc: Lower values mean the decoder produces more likely (aka boring) outputs (50 default)
xtts.topPDesc: Lower values mean the decoder produces more likely (aka boring) outputs (0.8 default)
xtts.speedDesc: The speed rate of the generated audio. Can produce artifacts if far from 1.0 (1.0 default)
xtts.enableTextSplittingDesc: Whether to split the text into sentences and generate audio for each sentence. Allows infinite input length but might lose important context between sentences (true default)

chatterbox.exaggerationDesc: Controls speech expressiveness. Neutral at 0.5, extreme values may be unstable (0.5 default)
chatterbox.temperatureDesc: Controls randomness in generation. Higher values = more varied (0.8 default)
chatterbox.cfgWeightDesc: CFG weight controlling generation guidance. 0 for language transfer (0.5 default)
chatterbox.seedDesc: Random seed for reproducible results. 0 = random generation (0 default)

kani.temperatureDesc: Controls randomness in generation. Higher values = more varied (0.7 default)
kani.topPDesc: Controls output diversity. Lower values = more focused output (0.9 default)
kani.maxTokensDesc: Maximum number of audio tokens to generate (2000 default)
kani.repetitionPenaltyDesc: Prevents repetitions. Higher values = fewer repetitions (1.2 default)
kani.speakerIdDesc: Choose one of the built-in voices: Bert or Thorsten

sileroVad.maxSilenceCriticalDesc: Maximum silence duration before critical error
